definition: to take charge of/to manage or direct/to preside over/to uphold/to stand for (justice etc)/to host (a TV or radio program etc)/(TV) anchor
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: Japan is hosting the meeting of delegates from the so-called G8, or group of eight industrialized nations.
sentences.chinese: 日本主持了八国集团代表会议。

sentences.english: TV host Yang Lan is one of China's biggest celebs.
sentences.chinese: 电视主持人杨澜是中国的名人之一。

sentences.english: The beauty host displayed the professional with fluent English.
sentences.chinese: 主持人用流利英语开始了庆典，展现了乐其的专业性。

sentences.english: Cui Yongyuan is a famous talk show host .
sentences.chinese: 崔永元是著名的脱口秀主持人。

sentences.english: Yang Hong and accepts the director East on-the-spot coverage in the Nanjing Television station.
sentences.chinese: 杨鸿并在南京电视台内接受主持人东方现场采访。

sentences.english: Deputy Director-General Liu Jianchao of the Information Department hosted the briefing.
sentences.chinese: 新闻司副司长刘建超主持吹风会。

sentences.english: The plain white background of the Olympic flag is symbolic of peace throughout the games .
sentences.chinese: 奥运会五环旗是在顾拜旦主持下制定的。

sentences.english: Dear Colleagues, It gives me great pleasure to co-chair the third round of the China-US Economic Dialogue together with Secretary Geithner.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴与盖特纳财长共同主持第三轮中美经济对话。

sentences.english: Then he presided the building of hospital and the establishing of the hygiene schools.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他主持了医院建设和卫生学校的建立。

sentences.english: Xing Zhibin, and Luo Jing anchor the 7p. m. "Network News Broadcast"on China Central Television.
sentences.chinese: 央视邢质斌，罗京主持晚7点的《新闻联播》。

sentences.english: Most people come to Toastmasters to overcome their fear of public speaking.
sentences.chinese: 许多人到宴会主持人之家来克服他们害怕演说的问题。

sentences.english: The school had been opened only last year by the agent to the governor-general .
sentences.chinese: 这所学校是去年由英属领地总督的代理人主持开幕的。

sentences.english: Later she went to work for China Central Television Station, presenting two variety shows.
sentences.chinese: 接着她又在中央电视台工作，主持两档综艺节目。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony was moderated by Du Qinglin, Minister of Agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 开幕式由农业部部长杜青林主持。

sentences.english: Yanzhou Mining Group, Song, deputy secretary of Party Committee chaired the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 兖矿集团党委副书记宋国主持会议。

definition: to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
China Central Television (CCTV), PRC state TV network
to attend a meeting as a nonvoting delegate
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
